title: 1 teenager shot 'just outside' California high school
text:
One teenager is injured after a shooting near Ridgway High School in Santa Rosa, California, Tuesday morning, authorities said.

A suspect is in custody, authorities said.

Santa Rosa police described the incident as an "isolated shooting just outside" of the school.

An "altercation occurred" at an intersection off of campus just before 8:56 a.m. local time and at least one shot was fired, said police.

A 17-year-old went to a trauma center with a gunshot wound to the abdomen and is in stable condition, police said. The "parents have been notified of his status," said police.

KGO

A suspect was spotted fleeing onto the high school campus after the shooting, said police.

Authorities initially said they were launching a search for "the lone shooter" and later said a suspect was detained and "there is no threat."

KGO

KGO

Santa Rosa is about 60 miles north of San Francisco.

Schools had been placed on lockdown. Police later lifted the lockdowns and said "there is no evidence that the weapon is on campus."
description: One teenager is injured after a shooting near Ridgway High School in Santa Rosa, California, Tuesday morning, authorities said.
